feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 13 at 4:36AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Skagway, White Pass, And Haines. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain Expected Through Thursday Night... A low pressure system over the eastern Gulf of Alaska will continue to move northwest along the coast through early Friday. Precipitation amounts across the region so far have been around 1 inch. Heavy rain will move over the area this evening with an additional 1 to 2 inches through Friday morning is expected. The latest satellite rain rate
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 3:06AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG DEVELOPING THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS ON FRIDAY... Areas of locally dense fog are developing across inland portions of Northeast Florida are expected to gradually expand in coverage through the early morning hours on Friday. A Dense Fog Advisory may need to be issued for portions of these areas before sunrise.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 12 at 10:46PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor rose a few tenths of a foot to reach 2.9 feet late this evening, but is now holding steady. The river level is expected to remain within Minor Flood Stage as it slowly falls through this weekend and into early next week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.summary: ...Patchy dense fog this morning... Favorable radiational cooling will allow for fog to develop into the early morning hours. Dense fog will be most prevalent in sheltered valleys and near bodies of water. Visibility could be reduced to less than one mile at times. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of space between you and the cars in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lee; Russell; Scott; Washington; Wise

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 5:21AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: Patchy fog this morning... Pockets of fog have developed this morning in the mountain valleys and along area rivers and lakes. The visibility in some locations was less than one mile.
